trans-unit.source: <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars"></xref> is a mutable reference type that wraps a <xref href="System.Char"></xref> array or a <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> instance.
<xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars> can be obtained for `varchar`, `nvarchar`, `char`, `nchar`, `text`, and `ntext` values, or can be created over an unmanaged buffer.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars"></xref> class.
The maximum length allowed for <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars> is bound by the common language runtime maximum size of an Int32 (2,147,483,647).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars"></xref> class based on the specified character array.
The maximum length allowed for <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars> is bound by the common language runtime maximum size of an Int32 (2,147,483,647).
If a null reference is passed in, the instance is set to null.
A <xref href="System.Char"></xref> array.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars"></xref> class based on the specified <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> value.
The maximum length allowed for <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars> is bound by the common language runtime maximum size of an Int32 (2,147,483,647).
If a null reference is passed in, the instance is set to null.
A <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref>.
Returns a reference to the internal buffer.
Returns a null reference for null value <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars>.
Throws an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> for stream-wrapped instances of <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars>.
Returns a reference to the internal buffer.
For <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars"></xref> instances created on top of unmanaged pointers, it returns a managed copy of the internal buffer.
Returns the XML Schema definition language (XSD) of the specified <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaSet"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaSet"></xref>.
A `string` value that indicates the XSD of the specified <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaSet"></xref>.
Gets a Boolean value that indicates whether this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars"></xref> is null.
The default value is `false`.
For more information, see [Handling Null Values](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/sql/handling-null-values.md).
`true` if the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars"></xref> is null.
Otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars"></xref> instance at the specified index.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value.
A <xref href="System.Char"></xref> value.
Gets the length of the value that is contained in the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars"></xref> instance.
The default value is 0.
A <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that indicates the length in characters of the value that is contained in the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars"></xref> instance.
Returns -1 if no buffer is available to the instance, or if the value is null.
Returns a <xref href="System.IO.Stream.Length"></xref> for a stream-wrapped instance.
Gets the maximum length in two-byte characters of the value the internal buffer can hold.
The default value is 0.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value representing the maximum length in two-byte characters of the value of the internal buffer.
Returns -1 for a stream-wrapped <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars"></xref>.
Returns a null instance of this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars"></xref>.
Returns an instance in such a way that <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars.IsNull"></xref> returns `true`.
For more information, see [Handling Null Values](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/sql/handling-null-values.md).
Copies characters from this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars"></xref> instance to the passed-in buffer and returns the number of copied characters.
If an attempt is made to read beyond <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars.MaxLength%2A>, an exception is thrown.
If `count` specifies more characters to be copied than are available from the `offsetInBuffer` to the end of the value, only the available characters are copied.
An exception is thrown if the destination buffer is a null reference.
An exception is thrown if the destination buffer cannot receive as many characters as requested.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref>`long` value offset into the value that is contained in the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars"></xref> instance.
The character array buffer to copy into.
An <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> integer offset into the buffer to start copying into.
An <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> integer value representing the number of characters to copy.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref>`long` value representing the number of copied bytes.
Sets the length of this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars"></xref> instance.
This method will trigger an internal conversion to a managed buffer for an instance built on top of an unmanaged buffer.
The <xref href="System.Int64"></xref>`long` value representing the length.
Sets this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars"></xref> instance to null.
Returns information about the storage state of this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars"></xref> instance.
A <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.StorageState"></xref> enumeration.
Converts this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars"></xref> instance to its equivalent <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> representation.
A <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString"></xref> representation of this type.
Returns a managed copy of the value held by this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars"></xref>.
Returns a null reference for null value <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars>.
The value of this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars"></xref> as an array of characters.
Copies characters from the passed-in buffer to this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars"></xref> instance.

If this operation writes to a position beyond <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars.Length%2A> but within <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars.MaxLength%2A>, <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars.Length%2A> is updated to reflect the new ending position.
The value of `offsetInBuffer` must be less than or equal to <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars.Length%2A>.
An exception is thrown otherwise.
Only a value of 0 can be specified when writing to a null value instance.
If an attempt is made to write beyond <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars.MaxLength%2A>, an exception is thrown.
A `long` value offset into the value that is contained in the <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars"></xref> instance.
The character array buffer to copy into.
An <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> integer offset into the buffer to start copying into.
An <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> integer representing the number of characters to copy.
Gets serialization information with all the data needed to reinstantiate this <xref href="System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlChars"></xref> instance.
The object to be populated with serialization information.
The destination context of the serialization.
This member supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
This member supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
This member supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
This member supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
